div.l: Thus swyvede was þe Carpynters wyfe
For all his kepenge And his Iellowsye
And absolou haþe kyssede her nether eye
And Nicholas is scallede in his Towte
This tale is doone and god saue all þe Rowte
Here endith the talle of the myller And
begynnythe the prolog of the reve
Whan Folke haþe laughen Atte this nyce case
Of Absolon ⁊and hende Nicholas
Diuerse Folke diuerselye they sayde
Butte For þe more parte þey laughe ⁊and playede
Ne atte þis tale I Sawe no Man hym greue
Butte hitt were onelye Oswald the Reue
Bicause he was of Carpynters crafte
A litulle Ire is in his herte lafte
He gan to grucche And blame itt Alyte
So thee yk qduod he Fulle wele I couþe you qwyte
With blerenge of A proude Myllers eye
Yefe þat me luste to Speke of rybawdye
Butte ykke Am olde me luste notte to playe for Age
Grasse tyme is doone My Fooder is Forage
The whyte toppe wryteþe myne olde yeres
Myne herte is allso Moulede As is myne heres
Butte yefe I Fare as dothe An opene erse
That ylke Fruyte is eủer lenger the werse
Tille hitt be rottone in Mulloke or in Stre
We olde Men I drede So Fare we
Tille we be rotten cānne we noughte be rype
We hoppen allwaye whyle þe worlde woll pype
For in ower wylle þere Styckeþe eủer an nayle
To hauene hore here and A grene tayle
As haþe A leke For þoughe ower myghte be gone
Ower wylle desyrethe eủer Follye in oone
